title: Good litter

text: Why did you pick this product vs others?:Some issues I have with this litter is that if they are REALLY young kittens (like if you start litter-training them right at 3 weeks) I worry about it being a clumping kind of litter (like imagine if young kittens accidentally eat CLUMPING litter with how curious they are; it can clump in their GI tract & be fatal). I highly suggest if you *DO* want the easy cleanup clumping litter provides, maybe do a light layer of this underneath/mixed with larger natural based pellet litter instead & monitor closely or make sure they're on a scheduled potty time where you can watch them for a week or 2. (it's usually recommended that while training you use a natural nonclumping litter like pellets or corn-based litter & a very shallow cardboard box they can easily step into, then you can easily throw the whole thing out after when it's full).¬†As they get older tho they might start digging more (whether out of boredom or playing) and kicking it around so it WILL create mess (kinda unavoidable), so keep that in mind as well. I think ours started doing that at about 7 weeks. The mess is not fun for sure and we did have issues with them accidentally stepping in the wrong spot after they'd use the bathroom sometimes for a little while so that would track gross mess too.¬†The good things about it tho is the kitten attract DEFINITELY works because it was not difficult training them at all (although we did train them kinda later at 5 weeks instead of 3-4) they took right to it and had no issues making a habit out of going in the litterbox (getting them not to play in it was another issue lol). The clumping of course does make the clean up very easy; it's very absorbent. The odor control is as good as it can be when you have 3 kittens lol like as long as i'm on top of scooping we're good on the smell of course.¬†Please just wait til their about 8 weeks as advertised on the package before using this for your kittens. go for pellets or corn-based (just anything natural and NON-clumping) for neonatal kittens younger than 8 weeks!!!!
date: Revisado en los Estados Unidos el 24 de junio de 2025
title: Used this when litter-training - NOT USUALLY RECCOMMENDED FOR NEONATAL KITTENS!!!

text: Who would believe that this really did attract kittens to get them to use the litter box?  It does.  I have 3 kittens, one used the litter box consistently, the other 2 just went in the corner, on our carpeted floor!  The landlord would not be happy.  As soon as I put this litter in the box, they started using it instead of the variegated brown carpet (Yes, it is the LANDLORD'S fault) the carpet looks like a pile of dirt would.  Cats don't have very discerning eyesight.  In fact, after I put half the box in the 2 litter boxes, one kitten jumped IN the box, and starting pawing in it and playing in it.  The kittens, 3.5 months old all started going exclusively in the litter box.  It really does work to get kittens on the right track.  The only drawbacks are that when they urinate in it, it clumps up about one tenth of the litter box.  When I take out the soiled litter, it really uses up a lot of the litter.  I have to refill it very frequently, but it does save my carpet.  And it does seem to attract bugs and flies more than any other litter I have used - I probably need to clean it more often.

Those attractants really are magic, drawing the kittens in (sometimes my adult cat will even sneak in to use their boxes despite having one all to himself). The majority of the kittens I foster are orphans and while litter box usage is mostly instinctual, having a quality litter definitely sets them up for success.It clumps well for both feces and urine. I recommend this to all the other fosters and anyone adding a new kitten to their home.

text: Edit #2: Changed to 5 stars. All 6 cats are using it consistently! It's expensive, but it lasts a really long time with consistent cleaning and topping off with fresh litter every couple of days. I'm impressed.Edit #1: 4 stars. 1 of the 2 stubborn kittens is now using the box after a week. Not only that, but their mother who has been eliminating outside of the box for over a year, onto clothes, towels, anything available, has started using the box with this kitten litter! The last kitten is still being stubborn, she's still eliminating all over the place, so it's not 100%.Awesome clumping, decent odor control, easy to keep clean, low dust. It's good stuff but overpriced.Original review: 1 star. I have 4 kittens, 11 wks old, and their parents. 2 of the kittens refuse to use the box, no matter what I use or how many times I put them in it, even if they're already in the process of elimination, they still run out and do it elsewhere. This litter is not working!

title: Originally gave it 1 star...works for adult cats too.

text: Firstly it arrived with a leaking box, so it went all over my hallway floor.  I took it outside to transfer into the litter box and the leaking box got it all over my path.As for what my cat thought of it - he didn't want to use it at all and if I encouraged him into it, he hated how the little grains stuck in his paws so he'd flick it off - making lots of mess.The tracking is unlike anything I've ever had - extremely messy!  Leaves a sort of clay mess and the grains go everywhere.  They are still stuck in my cat's paws now.I cannot comment on smell reduction or clumping with my cat not using it.For an expensive litter I had much higher expectations.I am extremely disappointed and frustrated, I only have a lot more mess to clean up now and more wasted money.  I will be seeking a refund

text: I was super concerned that my baby girl kitten wasn‚Äôt going to be able to learn to use the litterbox. She was in the very beginning but after about of worms, she had a very painful stool passed in the litterbox and started associating it with the pain she was experiencing. She was going everywhere - under the bed, in the garage, under the computer table. I would try to time her feedings and put her in the litterbox, but she would freak out even going near it.I took a chance on this litter and followed directions - cleaned out the litterbox completely and replaced what was in it with this litter. She immediately loved this litter so much, she was playing in the litterbox for over an hour! And then a miracle, she used it! I was able to transition her from this litter to the litter we normally use with just one box. This stuff is well worth it! And it holds odor so well and clumps very well so you get more out of the litter than the nonclumping kind. My only complaint is that it comes in a cardboard box instead of a bag. The cardboard box leaks a bit at the bottom seam. But its still a five star product! Thank you!

text: This is a scented litter that has a very fine texture. I bought this litter, along with a small litterbox set designed for kittens, for my newly adopted 8 week old kitten.  I generally avoid scented litter but this litter supposedly helps with the litter training.In the past, I have used regular litter for kittens with no problem.  In my opinion, this is a nice though not necessary product.I bought 2 boxes.  By the second box/two weeks later, I was mixing this litter with regular.  At this time, I also transitioned to a regular size/height litter box.  My 10 week old kitten had no problem with either the regular litter or regular size box.My kitten had only one out-of-litterbox accident before being litter-trained.  However, I don't know if this success was due to the litter or to the kitten.I would possibly recommend this litter for very young/small kittens (up to 10 weeks) or for a kitten that is having litter-training difficulty with regular litter.  Otherwise, as already stated, I think it's a nice but not necessary item.
